channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: All along north side of Victoria Road but particularly from 10m east of 165 down to Lynton, 21st November
item.description:
Great drifts of leaves with rubbish mixed in has been there for weeks (and reported before and marked fixed) is not fixed. The litter is the same litter. Now ice under leaves at night so v hazardous.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Victoria Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Green space corner of the building full of garbage, 21st November
item.description:
The green space at the corner of the building is filled with garbage that has been left there fore years. It needs proper cleaning as there are rats in the area. Area has been cleaned of weeds but the garbage has been left behind. It needs a proper cleaning and possibly the area should be used for a purpose and kept tidy

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Paget Terrace, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bed base and mattress dumped on pavement, 21st November
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Herbert Road, Woolwich

item.title: Pile of trees and bush cuttings and plastic bottles and high viz jacket, 21st November
item.description:
Huge pile of tree cuttings on actual road and blocking all one side of Coleman’s Heath. Very thick branches and an enormous amount.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Crouch Croft, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree over pruned., 21st November
item.description:
Yet another healthy mature tree in Kelsey Park has been massacred, presumably by Bromley Council contractors. Do these people even have NVQ1 in tree care? I joined the Friends of Kelsey Park to look after the park, but since then several important mature trees have been deliberately cut down, or as good as. Why can’t trees be left to grow in the park? I would respectively suggest that Bromley use a properly qualified tree expert in future, to err on the side of protecting and caring for trees, not always cutting them down ‘in case’. Bromley should concentrate on checking the health of trees on public roadside verges, where they really do cause problems. A recent gale brought a whole mature acer down in Kenwood Drive, narrowly missing people and houses. Apparently it had rotted at the base. These trees should be checked regularly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stone Park Avenue, Eden Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Building supply bags on pavement leaving very little room to walk by., 21st November
item.description:
Overflowing bins and building supply bags on the pavement - has been there for many months. Bins on the street instead of on properties along Mayfield Road. This leaves little room to pass and in the summer months with flies and smelly bins.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mayfield Road, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Logs in the stream below the waterfall in Kelsey Park, 21st November
item.description:
The stream has big logs and sticks in the water below the waterfall between the lower lake and the river. Please can they be removed as they stop the flow of water. It has been a problem for 6 weeks. A duck became trapped behind a log.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Court Downs Road, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Logs blocking waterfall in Kelsey Park between main lake and lower lake, 21st November
item.description:
Logs, litter and debris are blocking the waterfall flow between the main lake and the lower lake. The flow of water is restricted. It is littered with logs directly below the waterfall as well. It has been like this for 2 months and looks a mess. Please can the logs be removed to a place where they will not be thrown in the water fall again.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Court Downs Road, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
